SENT.plain: Esophageal cancer is more than ever a surgical problem
Modern diagnostic procedures facilitate individual staging, and risk analysis is important for adequate patient selection
Using both allows an individualized indication
Under multimodal therapeutic protocols, neoadjuvant treatment can best be evaluated and is recommended in locally advanced tumors: RCTx in SCC, and CTx in Barrett cancer
Here the Ivor-Lewis procedure is the surgical method of choice
Postoperative complications are always possible, but the management now is standardized and has largely decreased mortality
